sentence: The Committee’s baseline expectations for economic activity, the labor market, and inflation have not changed much since December: With appropriate monetary policy, we continue to expect moderate economic growth, further labor market improvement, and a return of inflation to our 2 percent objective in two to three years.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: The unemployment rate was 4.9 percent in the first two months of the year, about in line with the median of FOMC participants’ estimates of its longer-run normal level.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: A broader measure of unemployment that includes individuals who want and are available to work but have not actively searched recently and people who are working part time but would rather work full time has continued to improve.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: But there is still room for improvement: Involuntary part-time employment remains somewhat elevated, and wage growth has yet to show a sustained pickup.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: The improvement in employment conditions so far this year has occurred as economic growth appears to have picked up from the modest pace seen in the fourth quarter of last year.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Household spending is expanding at a moderate rate, supported by continued job gains and increases in inflation-adjusted incomes.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: In contrast, business investment has been weak, in part reflecting further reductions in oil drilling as a result of low oil prices.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: Net exports also remain soft as a consequence of subdued foreign growth and the earlier appreciation of the dollar.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: Looking ahead, the Committee expects that, with gradual adjustments in the stance of monetary policy, economic activity will continue to expand at a moderate pace and labor market indicators will continue to strengthen.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Ongoing economic growth and additional strengthening in labor market conditions are important factors underpinning the inflation outlook.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Overall consumer price inflation—as measured by the price index for personal consumption expenditures—stepped up to 1¼ percent over the 12 months ending in January, as the sharp decline in energy prices around the end of 2014 dropped out of the year-over-year figures.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Core inflation, which excludes energy and food prices, has also picked up, although it remains to be seen if this firming will be sustained.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: In particular, the earlier declines in energy prices and appreciation of the dollar could well continue to weigh on overall consumer prices.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: But once these transitory influences fade and as the labor market strengthens further, the Committee expects inflation to rise to 2 percent over the next two to three years.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: The Committee’s inflation outlook rests importantly on its judgment that longer-run inflation expectations remain reasonably well anchored.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: However, the stability of longer-run inflation expectations cannot be taken for granted.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Survey-based measures of longer-run inflation expectations are little changed, on balance, in recent months, although some remain near historically low levels.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Market-based measures of inflation compensation also remain low.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: Movements in these indicators reflect many factors and therefore may not provide an accurate reading on changes in the inflation expectations that are most relevant for wage and price setting.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Nonetheless, our statement continues to emphasize that, in considering future policy decisions, we will carefully monitor actual and expected progress toward our inflation goal.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: As always, each participant’s projections are conditioned on his or own—his or her own view of appropriate monetary policy, which, in turn, depends on each person’s assessment of the multitude of factors that shape the outlook.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Participants’ projections for growth of inflation-adjusted gross domestic product or GDP are just a touch lower than the projections made in conjunction with the December FOMC meeting.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: The median growth projection edges down from 2.2 percent this year to 2 percent in 2018, in line with its estimated longer-run rate.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: The median projection for the unemployment rate falls from 4.7 at the end of this year to 4.5 percent at the end of 2018, somewhat below the median assessment of the longer-run normal unemployment rate.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: The median path of the unemployment rate is a little lower than in December, in part reflecting a slightly lower median estimate of the longer-run normal unemployment rate.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: Finally, with the transitory factors holding down inflation expected to abate and labor market conditions anticipated to strengthen further, the median inflation projection rises from 1.2 percent this year to 1.9 percent next year and 2 percent in 2018.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: The median inflation projection for this year is a little lower than in December, but thereafter the median projections are unchanged.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: In addition, economic growth abroad appears to be running at a somewhat softer pace than previously expected.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: One reason for this is that market expectations for the path of policy interest rates have moved down, and the accompanying decline in longer-term interest rates should help cushion any possible adverse effects on domestic economic activity.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: Indeed, while stock prices have fallen slightly since the December meeting and spreads of investment-grade corporate bond yields over those on comparable-maturity Treasury securities have risen, mortgage rates and corporate borrowing costs have moved lower.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: Of course, the Committee will continue to monitor these developments closely and will adjust the stance of monetary policy as needed to foster our goals of maximum employment and 2 percent inflation.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Returning to monetary policy, as I noted earlier, the Committee decided to maintain its target range for the federal funds rate.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Such caution is appropriate given that short-term interest rates are still near zero, which means that monetary policy has greater scope to respond to upside than to downside changes in the outlook.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: The low level of the neutral federal funds rate may be partially attributable to a range of persistent economic headwinds that weigh on aggregate demand, including developments abroad, a subdued pace of household formation, and meager productivity growth.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: This view is implicitly reflected in participants’ projections of appropriate monetary policy.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: As the factors restraining economic growth are projected to fade further over time, the median rate rises to 3 percent by the end of 2018, close to its longer-run normal level.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: In other words, most Committee participants now expect that achieving economic outcomes similar to those anticipated in December will likely require a somewhat lower path for policy interest rates than foreseen at that time.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: These forecasts represent participants’ individual assessments of what appropriate policy would be given each person’s own current projections of the most likely outcomes for economic growth, employment, inflation, and other factors.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: So you have seen a shift this time in most participants’ assessments of the appropriate path for policy, and, as I tried to indicate, I think that largely reflects a somewhat slower projected path for global growth—for growth in the global economy outside the United States—and for some tightening in credit conditions in the form of an increase in spreads.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: But, given that the economy is now close to our maximum employment objective, you know, hopefully inflation is moving up—I mentioned, as you mentioned, recent readings on inflation have moved up.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: But, certainly, our projections are for a gradual increase in inflation, and the Committee—at least, most participants continue to expect that if we follow along this course, that some further adjustments in the federal funds rate will be appropriate but gradual.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: So I want to make clear that our inflation objective is 2 percent, and we are projecting a move back to 2 percent.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: And we are not trying to engineer an overshoot of inflation, not to compensate for past undershoots, so 2 percent is our objective.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: We did take note in the statement of the fact that inflation has picked up in recent months.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: I see some of that as having to do with unusually high inflation readings in categories that tend to be quite volatile without very much significance for inflation over time.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: So I’m wary and haven’t yet concluded that we have seen any significant uptick that will be lasting in, for example, in core inflation.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: But we note—the Committee notes, as it did in December, that we continue to monitor development trends and developments closely, and that would include both the fact that recent inflation readings have been on the high side, and, as I mentioned, on the other side, that readings on measures of inflation compensation and some survey measures have been on the low side.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: So, in that sense, there are risks around the inflation forecast in both—in both directions.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: So there has been a slight downgrading of the assessment of economic growth for this year.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: But, nevertheless, growth is expected to run in—somewhat in excess of potential, so that the labor market is expected to continue to tighten, and by the end of the year, even edge below levels that—of the unemployment rate—that are estimated to be longer in the normal run, and inflation is expected to gradually move back to 2 percent over time.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: We still have, weighing on inflation, the influence of earlier declines in energy prices and a prolonged effect from the appreciation of the dollar, but we do expect those transitory influences to fade.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: And with a continuing—continuing improvement in the labor market, I think we’ll see upward pressure on inflation.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: As I indicated in December—the Committee indicated in December, we want inflation to go back to 2 percent.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: But we also want to be careful not to see some significant overshoots, so that we would get behind the curve and potentially be faced with a need to tighten in a very rapid fashion later in a way that could undermine the sustainability of the employment gains we have had.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: But we do see some continued tightening in monetary policy to be appropriate in that event.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: So there has been, by many forecasters, a slight downgrading of forecasts of global growth in—over the coming several years.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: Chinese growth hasn’t proven a great surprise.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Japanese growth in the fourth quarter was negative, and that was something of a surprise.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: And with respect to the euro area, recent indicators suggest perhaps slightly weaker growth.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: So there’s been a number of emerging markets—as you know, we’re suffering under the weight of declines in oil prices that are affecting their economic activity.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Our neighbors both to the north and south, Canada and Mexico, are feeling the impacts of lower oil prices on their growth.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: So our projection for global growth, for those reasons, is slightly lower—not dramatically lower, but enough lower to make some difference to our forecast.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: We have six weeks, but there will be additional data on the labor market and on various factors that pertain to inflation.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: So let me start with the impact of oil prices on consumer spending.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: I have to say, it’s very difficult when you look at patterns of consumer spending to—there are many factors that influence it, and to definitively say that lower oil prices have not boosted consumer spending, I’m not sure we can really arrive at that conclusion in any—in any rigorous way.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: The typical—the average household in the United States with oil prices where they are now is probably benefiting around $1,000 a year.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: And, of course, on the other side, we are—and, you know, it may be that it will take a while, and it’s something that will slowly strengthen over time if oil prices stay low.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: With respect to impact of oil prices on inflation and what would happen if they move up, the Committee has generally tended to look through movements in oil prices, whether they were on the upside or on the downside, viewing it as a factor that should have a transitory influence.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: And when I say that, what I mean is that if oil prices move up during the time that it’s moving up, it raises inflation.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: And, similarly, oil prices have obviously moved down a great deal over the last year, and we’re not expecting them to move back to their previous levels but to stabilize at some level.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: They’re obviously volatile, but, as they stabilize, the influence will move out of both headline—of headline inflation.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: So if oil prices were to increase to 50, I mean, that would probably slightly move up our expected path for core inflation, maybe speed how rapidly we would move back to 2 percent, but I wouldn’t think that that would be something alone that would have great policy significance.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: First of all, the U.S. economy has been very resilient in recent months in the face of shocks, and we highlighted that right at the beginning of our statement, where we said that “economic activity has been expanding at a moderate pace despite the global economic and financial developments of recent months.” And that—that is important, that the U.S. economy continues to do well.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: And, in addition, oil prices have rebounded from their lows, and that eases concerns about the financial condition of some energy firms and the stresses facing some oil-producing economies.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: And, at the same time, low oil prices continue to boost household purchasing power.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: So I must say I’m—I do see broad-based improvement in the labor market, and I’m somewhat surprised that we’re not seeing more of a pickup in wage growth.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: But in the aggregate data, one doesn’t yet see any convincing evidence of a pickup in wage growth.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: So I do think, consistent with the 2 percent inflation objective, that there is certainly scope for further increases in wages.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: The fact that we have not seen any broad-based pickup is one of the factors that suggests to me that there is continued slack in the labor market, but I would expect wage growth to move up some.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: Gains in inflation-adjusted disposable income are running at a healthy pace.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: As I mentioned, households have benefited pretty significantly from lower oil prices, and measures of consumer sentiment do reflect—do reflect that.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: So let me start with the question pertaining to exchange rates.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: In—in a world with highly integrated capital markets, monetary policy actions in any country have effects—spillovers to other countries.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: That’s true of our monetary policy, and it’s true of other countries’ monetary policies.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: In part, that shows up through movements in exchange rates, and those movements are a factor that any country needs to take into account in deciding what is the appropriate stance of monetary policy.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: So the fact that there are these linkages is an important factor in designing a monetary policy.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: monetary policy is somehow constrained in a way that makes it impossible for our monetary policy to diverge from policies abroad.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Movements in exchange rates partly reflect that.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: So I should point out that I think what you’re talking about is the slight decline in the median estimate of the longer-run normal unemployment rate.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: That, and the slope of the path of rate increases combined with projections of relatively low inflation.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: So I—the path of rate increases maybe slightly reflects the modest decline in estimates of the longer-run normal unemployment rate.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: It’s also, as I mentioned, a reflection of shifts in other views about, for example, the likely pace of global growth that affects what we need, as a policy path, to achieve our objectives.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: But the slow pace of wage growth, the fact that part-time employment for economic reasons and voluntary part-time employment remains high—we have seen an upward move in labor force participation, which is heartening and suggests that there was scope there for further improvement in the labor market.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: My guess is that those things influenced individuals who wrote down a slightly lower number for the longer-run unemployment rate.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: So the Phillips curve posits that there is a relationship between the degree of slack in the labor market and inflation, and it is an empirical relationship that, while not absolutely tight, has been a consistent relationship over time, and I believe that relationship still holds.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: But the impact of shifts in the unemployment rate on inflation should not be overstated.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: The Phillips curve has become, according to most estimates, quite flat in the sense that movements in unemployment have only a modest impact on inflation, so we shouldn’t overblow how large that is.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: In addition, the Phillips curve theory suggests that inflation expectations are also an important driver of actual wage- and price-setting decisions and inflation behavior, and I believe there’s also solid empirical evidence for that.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: And it’s one of the reasons that I highlighted in my statement, and we continue to highlight in the FOMC statement, that we are tracking indicators of the inflation expectations that matter to wage and price setting.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: We know that household measures, even when households are asked about longer-term inflation—at longer-term inflation, they tend to move in response to salient changes in prices that they see every day.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: In particular, when gas prices go down, which is very noticeable to most households, you tend to see a view—you tend to see responses about long-term inflation marked down.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Inflation compensation as measured in financial markets also embodies a variety of risk premia and liquidity premia.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: And so, it’s also—we monitor those closely and discuss them in the statement in paragraph one, but, again, there’s not a straight read on what’s happening to the expectations that influence wage and price setting.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: The Committee continues to feel that we are on a course where the economy is improving and inflation is moving back up.
label: LABEL_1
